li.text: Many changes require a restart to take effect.

li.label: Verbose Mode
li.tooltip: Print lots of log messages. Useful for debugging.
Set default pawn hostility response (vanilla is Flee).

li.label: Allow Goodwill Rewards
li.tooltip: Set default value of allow goodwill rewards from factions (vanilla is true).

li.label: Allow Honor as Reward
li.tooltip: Set default value of allow honor as reward from factions (vanilla is true).

li.text:
Overrride the default RimWorld schedule with those specified below, with the following rules (assuming all options below are enabled):
NeverSleep | Night Shift | Biphasic | Day Shift BodyMastery/Never Sleep Gene > NightOwl > UV Sensitive > Very Sleepy > Sleepy > Low Sleep > Normal
Modifiers: Quick Sleeper reduce sleep time by 1/3
If avoidScheduledMoodDebuffs is enabled then sleep schedule for Night Owl/UV Sensitive is left as sleeping through the day even if the pawn has Quick Sleeper. This only modifies the pawns initial schedule upon recruitment; their schedule can always be changed afterwards in game.

li.label: Assign Body Mastery pawns the Never Sleep Schedule
li.tooltip: Assign any pawns with the Body Mastery trait the Never Sleep schedule.

li.label: Assign Never Sleep pawns the Never Sleep Schedule
li.tooltip: Assign any pawns with the Never Sleep gene the Never Sleep schedule.

li.label: Assign Night Owl pawns the Night Shift Schedule
li.tooltip: Assign any pawns with the Night Owl trait the Night Owl schedule.

li.label: Assign UV Sensitive pawns the Night Shift Schedule
li.tooltip: Assign pawns with UV sensitive genes (Dirtmoles, Sanguophages, etc.) the Night Shift schedule.

li.label: Assign Sleepy Pawns the Biphasic Schedule
li.tooltip: Assign pawns that have sleep modifying genes (Very Sleepy, Sleepy) the Biphasic schedule.

li.label: Assign "Normal" Pawns Day Shift
li.tooltip: Assign any pawns that don't meet the above criteria the Day Shift schedule (note that this includes pawns with the Low Sleep gene).

li.label: Reduce Sleep in Schedules for Quick Sleepers
li.tooltip: Reduce Sleep in Schedules for Quick Sleepers by ~ 1/3

li.label: Avoid Scheduled Mood Debuffs
li.tooltip: Do not reduce sleep in schedules for Night Owl/UV Sensitive even if the pawn has Quick Sleeper. This helps to prevent mood debuffs on those pawns for being awake during the day or in the sunlight. Body Mastery and Never Sleep schedules are not effected by this setting.

li.label: Automatically Expand Home
li.tooltip: Automatically expand the Home area (vanilla is true)

li.label: Auto Rebuild in Home
li.tooltip: Automatically rebuild buildings in the Home area which get destroyed (vanilla is false)

li.text: Comma separated list of areas to start a new game with (e.g., "Ship, Ship+, Work, Inside, Safe, Clean, Slaughter"). Enter up to 10 areas, or leave field blank to use RimwWorld's default of "Area 1." If you area using a mod like Areas Unlimted or TD Enhancement Pack's unlimited areas option, enter as many areas as you would like.

li.label: Use Manual Priorities
li.tooltip: Use manual work priorities rather than boolean (vanilla is false)

li.label: Enable Mech Repair by Default
li.tooltip: Enable automatically repairing colony mechs by default (vanilla default is false).

li.label: Make all Mechanitor Chips Nonflammable
li.tooltip: Make all mechanitor chips (signal, power focus, nano structuring) non flammable (vanilla default is only signal chips).

li.label: Landmark Visibility
li.tooltip: Show landmarks on world map by default -- no need to turn it on again every game (vanilla default is false).

li.text: For 100% worlds it can be nice to have additional time for Odyssey space site quests so that traveling around the world is not as punishing. You can also increase the distance at which these quests are located to further enhance the world traveling vibe (note that grav ship quests are not impacted as they can already appear far away from the colony).

li.label: Allow X Gravship Subquests (vanilla default is 3)
Multiply Odyssey Quest Expiration Time by X

li.text: (vanilla default is 1, I'd recommend 2-3 for a 100% world)
Odyssey Quest Generation Distance (vanilla default is 1~3, I'd recommend 1~5 for a 100% world):

li.label: Auto Cut by Default
li.tooltip: Enable auto cutting on wind turbines and animal pens by default (vanilla default is false).

li.label: Auto Strip Prisoners
li.tooltip: Enable auto stripping prisoners by default (vanilla default is false).

li.label: Auto Strip Arrested Colonists
li.tooltip: Enable auto stripping colonists by default when arrested (vanilla default is false).

li.label: Display Correct Milk Type on Animal Fullness Labels
li.tooltip: Instead of labeling all resource producing animals with "Milk Fullness" show the actual resource produced (e.g., Boomalopes are now labeled with "Chemfuel Fullness") (vanilla default is false, but should honestly just be true. This is much more of a bug fix than a setting).

li.label: Hide Learning Helper Button
li.tooltip: Hide learning helper button on the bottom right of the map.

li.label: Show Traits in Outfit Assignment
li.tooltip: Show relevant traits (Nudist, Bloodlust, etc.) in the UI for pawn outfit assignment (vanilla is false). Just like how drug related traits are shown for drug policy assignments.

li.label: Persist New Game Configuration
li.tooltip: Save new game setup (storyteller, difficulty, world size, etc.) and reuse it for the next new game.

li.label: Medical Defaults Persist Across Games
li.tooltip: Persist medical care default settings across games -- can set pawns to Herbal Medicine default once and never worry again (vanilla default is false).

li.label: Apparel Policies Persist Across Games
li.tooltip: Apparel policies persist across new games -- make your desired set of outfits once and keep them forever.

li.label: Drug Policies Persist Across Games
li.tooltip: Drug policies persist across new games -- make your desired set of drug policies once and keep them forever.

li.label: Food Policies Persist Across Games
li.tooltip: Food policies persist across new games -- make your desired set of food policies once and keep them forever.

li.label: Reading Policies Persist Across Games
li.tooltip: Reading policies persist across new games -- make your desired set of reading policies once and keep them forever.
All of these are off by default in vanilla.

li.label: Hydroponic Devilstrand
li.tooltip: Devilstrand can be grown in hydroponic basins.

li.label: Toxic Fallout Immune Devilstrand
li.tooltip: Devilstrand is immune to toxic fallout.

li.label: Toxic Fallout Immune Toxipotatos
li.tooltip: Toxipotatos are immune to toxic fallout.

li.label: Multiply Gauralen Pruning Speed by X
